hypothesis_content.title: BTC 4-Hour Bollinger Band Squeeze Breakout with Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC enters a period of low volatility (Bollinger Band Width on 4H chart < 0.02) within a NEUTRAL regime, a subsequent breakout above the 20-period SMA with a 150%+ spike in volume relative to the 20-period average will lead to a directional move of at least 3% in the breakout direction over the next 12 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often feature consolidation and compression. A Bollinger Band squeeze indicates a buildup of energy. A high-volume breakout from this compression is a classic technical signal that the market has chosen a short-term direction, often leading to a swift, exploitable move before the next equilibrium.
entry_conditions: BTC 4H Bollinger Band Width (20,2) < 0.02 for at least 3 consecutive periods
4H volume > 150% of 20-period volume average on breakout candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3% price move from breakout candle close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.5% below breakout candle low (for long) or 1.5% above breakout candle high (for short)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 12 hours after entry if TP/SL not hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such signals result in a false breakout (price returns inside the BBands) before achieving the 3% target, or the average win rate is below 52% over a 100-signal backtest.
